result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd Eric Crider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court waived the DNA surcharge as no sample was given.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable, cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest. Court orders the defendant not to live with the victim.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1. Credit for 2 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Eric Crider

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd Eric Crider in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Todd Eric Crider in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
AS TO COUNT 3:
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served, concurrent with count 1.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Attend Al-Anon.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest. Court orders the defendant not to live with the victim.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court waived the DNA surcharge as no sample was given.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable, cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Jury trial is vacated.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd Eric Crider in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.

As to Count 2 and Count 3:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 1  DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  No PSI ordered.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Todd Eric Crider in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.
Court listened to the CD recording of the 911 telephone calls and reviews her findings with the parties on the record.
Court orders case passed.

Defendant Todd Eric Crider in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 8/10/15 in Branch 40.  State put the offer on the record, defense rejected it.  Offer revoked.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Todd Eric Crider in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling Conference held off the record. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Statements made by Maticia F.  Court ordered the children removed from the no contact order.  3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.

Defendant Todd Eric Crider in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Todd Eric Crider in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Todd Eric Crider in custody.  Ron Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
